intro: Phyllota, commonly known as the "Mexican coffee plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the Americas, particularly Mexico and Central America, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Phyllota species are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage and unique floral structures. Some species are also used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits.
